## ADDITIONAL MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 300, 153, 314]]<|/det|>
Paper 1  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[782, 278, 905, 333]]<|/det|>
0606/13 May/June 2017 2 hours  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 339, 420, 355]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 390, 388, 407]]<|/det|>
## READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 416, 718, 432]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 432, 320, 446]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 446, 504, 461]]<|/det|>
You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 460, 504, 475]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 475, 380, 490]]<|/det|>
DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 501, 282, 515]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 515, 905, 545]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 545, 593, 560]]<|/det|>
The use of an electronic calculator is expected, where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 559, 603, 574]]<|/det|>
You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 585, 606, 600]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 600, 759, 615]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 615, 437, 630]]<|/det|>
The total number of marks for this paper is 80.

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[398, 73, 599, 91]]<|/det|>
Mathematical Formulae  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[437, 165, 561, 183]]<|/det|>
## 1. ALGEBRA  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 196, 240, 214]]<|/det|>
Quadratic Equation  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 225, 383, 245]]<|/det|>
For the equation \(a x^{2} + b x + c = 0,\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[411, 243, 586, 281]]<|/det|>
\[x = \frac{-b\pm\sqrt{b^{2} - 4ac}}{2a}\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 301, 228, 319]]<|/det|>
Binomial Theorem  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[243, 323, 754, 363]]<|/det|>
\[(a + b)^{n} = a^{n} + \binom{n}{1} a^{n - 1}b + \binom{n}{2} a^{n - 2}b^{2} + \ldots +\binom{n}{r} a^{n - r}b^{r} + \ldots +b^{n},\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 371, 495, 408]]<|/det|>
where \(n\) is a positive integer and \(\binom{n}{r} = \frac{n!}{(n - r)!r!}\)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[401, 470, 594, 489]]<|/det|>
## 2. TRIGONOMETRY  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 502, 156, 520]]<|/det|>
Identities  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[420, 530, 580, 600]]<|/det|>
\[\sin^{2}A + \cos^{2}A = 1\] \[\sec^{2}A = 1 + \tan^{2}A\] \[\csc^{2}A = 1 + \cot^{2}A\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 630, 242, 648]]<|/det|>
Formulae for \(\Delta ABC\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[408, 653, 590, 686]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{a}{\sin A} = \frac{b}{\sin B} = \frac{c}{\sin C}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[401, 705, 593, 730]]<|/det|>
\[a^{2} = b^{2} + c^{2} - 2bc\cos A\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[438, 734, 558, 763]]<|/det|>
\[\Delta = \frac{1}{2} bc\sin A\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 82, 99, 102]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 82, 148, 102]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 81, 803, 102]]<|/det|>
On the Venn diagram below, shade the region which represents \((A \cap B') \cup (C \cap B')\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 82, 918, 101]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 294, 791, 314]]<|/det|>
Complete the Venn diagram below to show the sets \(Y\) and \(Z\) such that \(Z \subset X \subset Y\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 295, 920, 314]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 522, 438, 541]]<|/det|>
Given that \(y = 3 + 4\cos 9x\), write down

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 553, 144, 572]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 553, 311, 572]]<|/det|>
the amplitude of \(y\),

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 553, 920, 572]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 631, 144, 650]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 631, 282, 650]]<|/det|>
the period of \(y\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 631, 920, 650]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 144, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 751, 92]]<|/det|>
On the axes below, sketch the graph of \(y = 3\sin x - 2\) for \(0^{\circ}\leqslant \theta \leqslant 360^{\circ}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 106, 915, 358]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 470, 141, 489]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 470, 784, 489]]<|/det|>
Given that \(0\leqslant |3\sin x - 2|\leqslant k\) for \(0^{\circ}\leqslant x\leqslant 360^{\circ}\), write down the value of \(k\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 470, 920, 489]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 71, 94, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 71, 510, 90]]<|/det|>
In this question, all dimensions are in centimetres.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[203, 103, 789, 243]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 262, 920, 299]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows an isosceles triangle \(ABC\), where \(AB = AC\). The point \(M\) is the mid-point of \(BC\). Given that \(AM = 3 + 2\sqrt{5}\) and \(BC = 4 + 6\sqrt{5}\), find, **without using a calculator**,

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 312, 143, 330]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 312, 351, 330]]<|/det|>
the area of triangle \(ABC\),

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 312, 920, 331]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 543, 141, 561]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 536, 863, 567]]<|/det|>
tan \(ABC\), giving your answer in the form \(\frac{a + b\sqrt{5}}{c}\) where \(a, b\) and \(c\) are positive integers. [3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 75, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
The normal to the curve \(y = \sqrt{4x + 9}\) , at the point where \(x = 4\) , meets the \(x\)- and \(y\)-axes at the points \(A\) and \(B\). Find the coordinates of the mid-point of the line \(AB\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 88, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
<mark>[7]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 92, 97, 112]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 87, 144, 109]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 78, 660, 128]]<|/det|>
Given that \(\mathbf{A} = \begin{pmatrix} 3 & 1 \\ 2 & 4 \end{pmatrix}, \mathbf{B} = \begin{pmatrix} 5 & 1 \\ 2 & 4 \\ - 1 & 0 \end{pmatrix}\) and \(\mathbf{C} = \begin{pmatrix} - 5 & 2 \\ 3 & 1 \end{pmatrix}\), find

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 138, 180, 157]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 136, 262, 156]]<|/det|>
\(\mathbf{A} + 3\mathbf{C}\),

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 138, 920, 157]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 278, 180, 297]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 278, 230, 297]]<|/det|>
BA.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 279, 920, 298]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 494, 143, 514]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 485, 180, 512]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 484, 472, 522]]<|/det|>
Given that \(\mathbf{X} = \begin{pmatrix} 1 & - 3 \\ 4 & - 2 \end{pmatrix}\), find \(\mathbf{X}^{- 1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 494, 920, 514]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 662, 180, 682]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 655, 537, 694]]<|/det|>
Hence find \(\mathbf{Y}\), such that \(\mathbf{X}\mathbf{Y} = \begin{pmatrix} 5 & - 10 \\ 15 & 20 \end{pmatrix}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 664, 920, 684]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 79, 146, 98]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 767, 102]]<|/det|>
Given that \(x = 3 \sin \phi\) and \(y = \frac{3}{\cos \phi}\) , find the numerical value of \(9y^2 - x^2 y^2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 75, 920, 96]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 97, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 75, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
It is given that \(\mathrm{p}(x) = 2x^{3} + ax^{2} + 4x + b\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are constants. It is given also that \(2x + 1\) is a factor of \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) and that when \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) is divided by \(x - 1\) there is a remainder of \(-12\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 121, 144, 140]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 121, 379, 140]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(a\) and of \(b\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 121, 920, 140]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 406, 143, 425]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 406, 920, 441]]<|/det|>
Using your values of \(a\) and \(b\), write \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) in the form \((2x + 1)\mathrm{q}(x)\), where \(\mathrm{q}(x)\) is a quadratic expression.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 425, 920, 444]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[106, 710, 141, 728]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 708, 594, 728]]<|/det|>
Hence find the exact solutions of the equation \(\mathrm{p}(x) = 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 708, 920, 727]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 79, 94, 98]]<|/det|>
<label>9</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 442, 107]]<|/det|>
It is given that \(\int_{-k}^{k}(15\mathrm{e}^{5x} - 5\mathrm{e}^{-5x})\mathrm{d}x = 6.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 125, 143, 144]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 123, 358, 144]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\mathrm{e}^{5k} - \mathrm{e}^{-5k} = 3.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 125, 920, 144]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 549, 141, 567]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 546, 730, 567]]<|/det|>
Hence, using the substitution \(y = \mathrm{e}^{5k}\), or otherwise, find the value of \(k\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 546, 920, 565]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 104, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>10</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 432, 92]]<|/det|>
It is given that \(y = (10x + 2)\ln (5x + 1)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 101, 143, 120]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 100, 230, 120]]<|/det|>
Find \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 102, 920, 121]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 490, 141, 509]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 483, 920, 532]]<|/det|>
Hence show that \(\int \ln (5x + 1)\mathrm{d}x = \frac{(ax + b)}{5}\ln (5x + 1) - x + c\) , where \(a\) and \(b\) are integers and \(c\) is a constant of integration.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 512, 920, 531]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[104, 81, 141, 101]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 72, 910, 116]]<|/det|>
Hence find \(\int_{0}^{\frac{1}{5}} \ln (5x + 1) \mathrm{d}x\), giving your answer in the form \(\frac{d + \ln f}{5}\), where \(d\) and \(f\) are integers. [2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 104, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>11</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 405, 92]]<|/det|>
A curve has equation \(y = 6x - x\sqrt{x}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 103, 144, 122]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 103, 594, 123]]<|/det|>
Find the coordinates of the stationary point of the curve.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 104, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 440, 141, 459]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 440, 510, 460]]<|/det|>
Determine the nature of this stationary point.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 441, 920, 460]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[104, 694, 141, 712]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 693, 836, 712]]<|/det|>
Find the approximate change in \(y\) when \(x\) increases from 4 to \(4 + h\), where \(h\) is small.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 693, 920, 712]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 104, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>12</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 890, 109]]<|/det|>
A particle moves in a straight line, such that its velocity, \(v \mathrm{~m} \mathrm{~s}^{- 1}\) , \(t \mathrm{~s}\) after passing a fixed point \(O\), is given by \(v = 2 + 6t + 3 \sin 2t\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 121, 143, 140]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 121, 507, 140]]<|/det|>
Find the acceleration of the particle at time \(t\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 121, 920, 140]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 306, 141, 324]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 305, 801, 324]]<|/det|>
Hence find the smallest value of \(t\) for which the acceleration of the particle is zero.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 306, 920, 324]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[106, 524, 141, 543]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 523, 621, 543]]<|/det|>
Find the displacement, \(x\) m from \(O\), of the particle at time \(t\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 523, 920, 542]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]
